overview: From 2025-11-23 to 2025-11-30, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 42 new PRs (22 merged), 34 new issues, and 51 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-acceptance-test: add back op-reth to jovian kt-devnet
topIssues.author: wlawt
topIssues.body:
Right now op-reth doesn't have the min base fee. So this issue is created to track that once op-reth is updated then we can add back the image to the yaml file.

Context: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17441#discussion_r2352622905

topIssues.title: Runbook Routing
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body:
Document a process for figuring out which Runbook to use for the Proofs system.
In particular, it should be clear, based on on-chain information, which runbook to use for any given proofs deployment.

topIssues.title: op deployer with custom intent (faultGameClockExtension, faultGameMaxClockDuration)  reverts
topIssues.author: InoMurko
topIssues.body:
My guess is that op deployer for some reason does not like modified   
faultGameClockExtension = 3600
faultGameMaxClockDuration = 14400

because if standard are used, then deployment works:
  faultGameClockExtension = 10800
  faultGameMaxClockDuration = 302400


**Bug Description**
Using op-deployer with a custom intent file:
```
configType = "custom"
l1ChainID = 84532
fundDevAccounts = false
l1ContractsLocator = "https://storage.googleapis.com/oplabs-contract-artifacts/artifacts-v1-b112b16f8939fbb732c0693de3d3bd1e8e3e2f0771f91d5ab300a6c9b7b1af73.tar.gz"
l2ContractsLocator = "https://storage.googleapis.com/oplabs-contract-artifacts/artifacts-v1-b112b16f8939fbb732c0693de3d3bd1e8e3e2f0771f91d5ab300a6c9b7b1af73.tar.gz"

[superchainRoles]
  SuperchainProxyAdminOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  SuperchainGuardian = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  ProtocolVersionsOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  Challenger = "0x267dbd8ed34722e59639224ae3c5360a46328403"

[[chains]]
  id = "0x00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000002dddf153b"
  baseFeeVaultRecipient = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
  l1FeeVaultRecipient = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"

  eip1559DenominatorCanyon = 250
  eip1559Denominator = 50
  eip1559Elasticity = 6
  gasLimit = 60000000
  operatorFeeScalar = 0
  operatorFeeConstant = 0
  minBaseFee = 0
  daFootprintGasScalar = 0
  [chains.roles]
    l1ProxyAdminOwner = "0x4da3c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f2fbf"
    l2ProxyAdminOwner = "0x5eb4c5d00ffd28c0c1b8f92d1720e722ea5f40d0"

    eip1559Denominator = 50
    enableGovernance = false
    gasPriceOracleBaseFeeScalar = 1101
    gasPriceOracleBlobBaseFeeScalar = 659851
    l1FeeVaultMinimumWithdrawalAmount = "0xde0b6b3a7640000"

[globalDeployOverrides]
```

topIssues.title: Kona + Cannon: runbook updates
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body:
Update OP Labs runbooks for the procedure to switch to Kona + Cannon as a fault proof.

Determine the risks and requirements around different chains in the Superchain having different respected game types and fallback path.

topPRs.title: feat: cgt
topPRs.author: hexshire
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Based on top of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17412

Enables OP Stack chains to use an asset other than ETH as their native fee currency by introducing a minimal, flexible, and standardizable Custom Gas Token (CGT) architecture. To do so, it introduces new predeploys (`NativeAssetLiquidity` and `LiquidityController`) that decouple native asset management from core bridging operations while using a single `isCustomGasToken()` flag that disables ETH transfer flows in all bridging methods. The two new pre-deploys manage the native asset supply.

**Tests**

Core contracts:

- `OptimismPortal` and `L1Block`: Tests for `isCustomGasToken()` flag blocking ETH deposits/withdrawals
- `NativeAssetLiquidity`: Tests deposit/withdraw access control and functionality
- `LiquidityController`: Tests minter authorization, mint/burn operations, and metadata functions

**Metadata**

- Spec: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/749
- Design Doc: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/305

-----------
**Contributors**
- @0xOneTony
- @0xniha
- @agusduha
- @ashitakah
- @hexshire
- @Joxess
- @tynes

topPRs.title: op-service: new bgpo module
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
This PR is adding a `BlobGasPriceOracle`, similar to the `GasPriceOracle` in `go-ethereum`.

This oracle makes a `newHeads` subscription, and processes all new blocks and headers and builds an in-memory cache of blob prices, so that it can suggest competitive blob fee cap values to the transaction manager.

Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/18102

topPRs.title: op-interop-filter: Service skeleton with flags and metrics
topPRs.author: karlfloersch
topPRs.body:
---------

<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Adds the op-interop-filter service skeleton:
1. CLI flags with StringSliceFlag for `--l2-rpcs` (chain ID queried from RPC)
2. Service lifecycle (start/stop) following op-service patterns
3. RPC server with supervisor namespace for `checkAccessList`
4. Metrics with `doc` subcommand for documentation
5. Stub backend (actual logic in follow-up PR)

This service validates interop executing messages for op-geth/op-reth transaction filtering. Any reorg triggers failsafe which disables all interop transactions.

**Tests**

Unit tests will be added in the follow-up logic PR. This skeleton PR focuses on service structure.

completedItems.body:
**Description**

Starts to build out the OptimisticZK contract bindings and make challenger not require everything to look like a FaultDisputeGame. Chose to make the ZK contracts independent rather than trying to have a base class with sh
